title: GOP Senator Stands Up To Fight Teamster Boss DURING HEARING In Insane Video: "You want to run your mouth..."
description:
We had a wild day in Congress after we argued about who bumped into whom in the hallway over an elbow accusation. If you thought that was a breach of decorum, wait until you hear about this.

Look, when someone says “any time” and “any place,” you would think that means any time and any place. But of course, we can't expect Teamsters President Sean O'Brien to put his money where his mouth is.

A physical altercation almost broke out at a Senate committee hearing as GOP Sen. Markwayne Mullin stood up and almost fought O'Brien, who has been trash-talking the GOP lawmaker for several months on social media.

Watch as Sen. Bernie Sanders was forced to keep the peace between the two.<

title: NY Gov Admits Out Loud To Social Media Surveillance, Government Will "Reach Out" If They Catch You Using "Hate Speech"
description:
Big Sister is now watching.

George Orwell predicted a future of a dystopian surveillance state where words are monitored, unacceptable speech is censored, and a person's existence can be denied for ideological thought crimes.

Unfortunately, we are now in a time where acceptable speech is decided by both elected and unelected bureaucrats over what is permitted online.

New York Gov. Kathy Hochul announced Monday that the state is “very focused” on collecting data from social media platforms as part of an effort to counter online “negativity” and “hate speech” after a rise in antisemitic attacks.

title: Court Dismisses Hate Crime Charges Against Politician, "It Isn’t a Crime to Tweet a Bible Verse"
description:
Religious freedom is essential for maintaining a free society. Unfortunately, all around the Western World, Religious liberty continues to be under attack.

The Helsinki Court of Appeal has dismissed all charges against Finnish Member of Parliament Päivi Räsänen and Lutheran Bishop Juhana Pohjola, who were both tried for “hate speech” after they publicly expressed their Christian beliefs.

title: Watch: Guy in Josh Allen jersey has more fight in him than the QB, drops violent BOMBS on another fan as the crowd sings along
description:
This is the most Buffalo Bills fight ever, but at least the fans are showing life in them because the Bills stink right now. Josh Allen has lost to the Jets, the Patriots, and now the Broncos. Meanwhile, a guy in a Josh Allen jersey is undefeated in beating other fans with his fists.

Football fights are a nice palate cleanser from the usual suck of covering the Middle East, woke cartoons, and Bidenomics. This specific fight lets me rant. It's a win-win.

Unfortunately, the guy recording fumbled the content like he was a Bills running back. The fight had started, and while he remembered to do it for the content, it took him a few seconds before he realized he wasn't recording the fight. He was recording people watching the fight.

title: Watch: Columbia University students go full-blown Karen over truck "doxxing" peers who signed pro-Hamas letter
description:
Accuracy in Media has been driving a truck around college campuses where students signed a letter in support of Hamas and are displaying their names on a screen. Critics of this action refer to it as "doxxing," and at Columbia University, a gaggle of women would not calm down about it.

AIM's decision to do this is not without controversy. Personally, I don't believe people should be canceled for dumb, offensive, and ignorant things they do in college. By the same token, do I care that people who would cancel me over supporting Ron DeSantis or tweeting that boys shouldn't compete in girls' sports are being canceled themselves?

title: Pop-tartlet P!nk is giving out copies of books deemed too pornographic for your kids, thinks she's owning Ron DeSantis
description:
For reasons known only to Leftists, keeping porn out of school classrooms is considered "book banning." Even though, if you want to get your hands on these materials, Amazon can have them delivered to you in the afternoon. The latest is popstar P!nk, who is giving out copies of books banned in Florida at her Florida concerts.

"Banned in Florida." That's a key point we're going to circle back to.

The singer is teaming up with a left-wing organization and said in an Instagram post that she is unwilling to stand by and watch while books are "banned" by schools. “It’s especially hateful to see authorities take aim at books about race and racism and against LGBTQ authors and those of color."

She's doing this in Florida because that's where presidential candidate Ron DeSantis opened

title: Kid Rock, Jason Aldean announce co-headlining music festival guaranteed to trigger the Left
description:
Kid Rock and Jason Aldean announced a co-headlining music festival, "Rock the Country." The two-day festival is treking out to try that in a small town (folks, these are the jokes) as the 7-stop, two-day festival is looking to bring "big names to small towns.”

Rock said of the tour, “Can’t wait to bring you Rock the Country. A music festival like no other for hard-working folks who love this country!”

This could be conjecture on the part of us here at the Louder with Crowder Dot Com website. But I'm guessing promoters knew what they were doing when they paired Aldean with Rock. This isn't the Kid Rock/Kelsea Ballerini co-headlining tour, nor are they sending Aldean out with Maren Morris.

The two outspoken headliners have been lightening rods for controversy over sharing political opinions slightly to the right

title: Daycare Employees Accused Of Running Child Fight Club, Encouraging Toddlers To Assault Each Other
description:
There are many people among us who disregard the dignity of human life, especially that of children. When a culture normalizes these sorts of attitudes through things like abortion, it is not surprising when we see people engaging in evil behaviors that are intended to be destructive toward kids.

Unfortunately, we have a disturbing story coming out of South Carolina for you.

Two daycare employees are accused of running a child fight club, where they allegedly encouraged toddlers to assault each other.
